hierarchy.entry_domain: NIST SP 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls

active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the potential security risks of skipping post-maintenance verification in a cloud-based system. Provide real-world examples or counterexamples from cybersecurity incidents (e.g., incidents where unverified maintenance led to backdoors) and debate mitigation strategies. Consider how this aligns with MA-2 goals of maintaining integrity and confidentiality.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST SP 800-53 controls. Generate 40-60 high-quality Anki-compatible flashcards for the topic 'Controlled Maintenance Procedures (MA-2)' in the hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Control Frameworks > NIST SP 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls > Maintenance (MA) > Controlled maintenance procedures (MA-2). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [REMEMBER: Define...], [UNDERSTAND: Explain...], etc. (as listed above). Distribute cards evenly across 6 objectives. - Scaffolding: Cover 4 layers progressively (use prior knowledge/big picture for context cards). 20% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 30% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. - Active Learning Tie-ins: Include 5-10 cards prompting application/discussion (e.g., 'In a scenario where..., what MA-2 step is missing?'). - Content Sources: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53r5); Core concepts: scheduling/documentation/approval/monitoring/off-site/verification/records; Enhancements: MA-2(1) Timely, MA-2(2) Automated; Links: MA-3, CM-2, RA-5. Use this Flashcard Schema: - Formats: 1/3 Basic Q&A, 1/3 Cloze, 1/3 MCQ (4 options, 1 correct). - Distractors: Misconceptions (no approval needed), partial truths, unrelated controls. - Each card: {'id': unique number, 'type': 'basic/cloze/mcq', 'front': string, 'back': string (answer + explanation + [Bloom: LEVEL] + [Layer: #] + NIST ref), 'tags': ['MA-2', 'NIST', objective shorthand, layer #]}. Output ONLY a JSON array of objects matching this schema. Ensure variety, no duplicates, optimized for active recall and higher-order thinking. Cover enhancements and real-world risks comprehensively.
